title: Thunderbird occasionally breaks a reply-to html stream resulting in html code being displayed to the recipient
content:
Is this exclusively an effect of my cutting text in a reply-to email for brevity of my reply ?

e.g.

>On 24/2/2024 8:41 am, Robin and Adrian [...] wrote:

> @font-face {font-family:"Cambria Math"; panose-1:2 4 5 3 5 4 6 3 2 4;}@font-face {font-family:Calibri; panose->1:2 15 5 2 2 2 4 3 2 4;}@font-face {font-family:Aptos;}p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal {margin:0cm; >margin-bottom:.0001pt; font-size:12.0pt; font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;}a:link, span.MsoHyperlink {mso->style-priority:99; color:blue; text-decoration:underline;}a:visited, span.MsoHyperlinkFollowed {mso-style->priority:99; color:purple;

> ... etc etc for over a page long

I'm happy to try to replicate it if someone can offer suggestions.

[ using Thunderbird for Mac 115.8.0 (64-bit) but the issue is not new ]

many thanks for your support / suggestions

- rob d
creator: robert.r.dickinson

title: Cannot Add Multiple Outlook Accounts
content:
I've done this before multiple times but it seems to not work now and I'm at my wits end. I think trying to connect more than one outlook accounts is purely RNG at this point. I study and work in a college and need to access to the two emails being used from the schools mail server on my Linux machine.

The problem is that both require Oauth2 and and a seperate login scnreen, I've gotten both, at the same installation, to work multiple times before. But its purely by luck and with no connection to how it didn't break that time around.

I saw a post saying to change the names of the server but that's no longer working, and one saying to use 'smtp-mail.office.com' for one, 'smtp.office365.com' for the other nut no matter in which order ior amount i use those servers its still not working.

Is it possible that Thunderbird sandboxes the accounts properly, and it actually doesn't use the same SMTP server from another account?

Does anyone have any solution to this?
creator: tegaidogun

title: Assign a category to all events in a calendar
content:
Hi,

For a few years now, I've separated all of my events into multiple calendars. There's a calendar called "School", one called "Social Events", one called "Family" etc.

Now, I need to merge all of these calendars together to make syncing easier, but at the same time, I need to keep the events distinguishable from each other based on the calendar of their origin. I need to use categories for this, as far as I know.

Now the question is, how do I select all events in one calendar, assign all of them a certain category and then move all of them to one new "Merged" calendar?

I tried asking AI and it seems like Thunderbird doesn't support it. If it was correct, are there some workarounds to do this, for example, some open-source scripts to modify the exported ICS files and set the categories in them?

Thanks.
creator: ShadyMedic

title: HTML css options - unable to locate action
content:
With the new html rather than the old style css options I am looking for the way to:-

1) Provide lines under each entry in the inbox etc (used to be easy)

2) Possibly do "zebra" lines on inbox entries

3) Add vertical separators between icons in the menu

4) Probably impossible, but.... I usually use Thunderbird 2 (yes 2!) for pop mail and sending indecure stuff, but looking to move too SSL mail, hence trying 115. I have used the old V2 profile and works, but, I use 8 pop accounts and under V2 you just had a single joint inbox (and single folder for the rest) for all the accounts. Worked fine and therefore didn't have a long list on the left hand pane. Still works but IF i try to edit any of the accounts in \tools\account settings it brings up error:- "The Local Directory path "F:\Users\?????\Mail" is not suitable for message storage. Please choose another directory." I know this mixed setting was removed back in the earlier versions, but why? If I make changes, then they do stick...I can also edit the entries directly in prefs.js but if I want to add an account, then I have to use the profile in V2, (and delete the .msf files otherwise does od things), then add the new account then move the profile back to V115.

This seems very long winded and have no idea why this great feature was removed...any one know how to get back?
creator: SumoBot

creator: mozilla533

title: Export multiple emails from thunderbird
content:
We have been using Thunderbird for years and love it. I have a considerable amount of emails now stored/filed under local folders which does well to keep my inbox clean. But they do take up space on my Hard Drive. I have a Dell which uses 2 drives- one with flash smaller at 500G and another with a Terabyte So I have several questions which relate to moving those emails off to another drive or location

  • I can export each email individually as HTML or save as a txt file and move it to another Drive (portable or to my larger D drive)

-this is time consuming when dealing with 1000 + emails -is there a program that will do that for multiple email files at one time? Either at Thunderbird utility or 3rd party?

  • Is there a way to re-direct my "local files" saved in the Thunderbird profile to point to a location on my secondary D drive where I have more space?

Many of the emails are for business and so we do need to keep them for past referencing. Not often, but they need to be retained Any suggestions would be most helpful!
creator: nancylcutter

title: Disappered synchronized emails in inbox.
content: I double or multiple clicked the Get Messages button. The Thuderbird app hung abit, then my inbox was empty, except for one new email that came in. Could a synchronization error result in the loss of 1000 plus synchronized emails stored locally in my inbox? The local inbox emails were deleted on the IMAP server when downloaded. They don't show up anywhere at all. No sub-folders, trash or anywhere else. I did however end up with 1000 empty emails all dated for 1969 with no information in them at all, no headers no content, just dates. How do I find the real emails? There are two files with today's date on them labeled inbox in the inbox folder for Thunderbird. One has a . One looks large enough to be the correct one. It has a .MSF extension, the other has none. I am a long time user and will likely be looking for a new app if I can not recover these emails. Allen M. Abrahams
